reviewText:
This is a fun and addictive little platformer. The graphics are charming and cute, although I wouldn't say it's as good as Pixar (don't know what crack pipe that guy was smoking who said that.)

You play as a firefly (duh) who flys around collecting his babies throughout the level and the objective is to get them to the ending unharmed. In order to complete each stage you don't have to save them all, just as many as each stage says you have to, but if you want to earn a medal then you have to save them all (earning medals unlocks achievements.)

There are three medals in each stage. Earn one for collecting all the coins in each stage, another for saving all the firefly babies and another for completing each stage in a set amount of time. If you want this game to be challenging then you're going to want to collect the medals. Otherwise you'll breeze through this game (maybe not if you're a young kid or you just really suck at these type of games.) It's pretty short with only three worlds with 10 levels and a boss battle in each. I'm already at world 2-4 and that's with going back to collect all the medals. If I didn't care about that I'd probably already be near the end.

But I like I said: Fun. Addictive. Cute.

And it's for all ages!

reviewText: Ugh.  This game is a toilet game".  The kind of game you play while on the toilet.  It is clearly a bad port of a tablet/phone app and wasn't optimized at all for PC.  The input tab on the start "screen" claims to have WASD support but trying to press WASD in the game does nothing (arrow keys too).  You have to click to tell where you want the character to go.  I'd be okay with it if it was click-and-hold to move the character.  But this game requires a click for every little bit.  According to Steam
date: I've only played for five minutes.  I'm tolerant of most control schemes as long as I can use the keyboard
recommended: but the control scheme is clearly not PC-oriented and the keyboard controls are not functional at all.  Don't waste your time or money - there are better games out there."

reviewText: Don't get me wrong, I love the game for its content. The graphics are cute and fun and it's an interestingly-executed platformer. That being said, I can't recommend this game because the controls feel like murder, especially when you're trapped clicking all over with a mouse. While I haven't tried it with a controller, it'd be so much better if the developer could implement WASD/arrow key controls.
voteText: 16 of 21 people (76%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Not bad. Clearly a mobile/touchscreen game, and controls on keyboard and mouse suck. Using a controller works, although things like clicking on hint flowers and using the flower to finish the level don't work with it, so you still have to use mouse there, which is a clear mistake, but not a big one. The controller works quite well, except for landing, which is finnicky and unnecessarily hard to do. There is really no story. The levels start to seem somewhat repetitive, as in every single one you rescue fireflies and have to have them follow you to the end. A few different enemies come on every 5-10 levels or so, but that's about it, as you don't get any new powers or abilities. You just dodge, throw the same seeds, and knock rocks on to block water. There are some boss fights which are welcome and change things up, but that's about it. The game is pretty short too. It wasn't a bad platformer-esque game, but leaves no lasting impression. 7/10.

reviewText:
My 4,5-year son loves this game. First world is ok for him, second is a bit too hard for now.

It plays ok with a gamepad for both of us (though maybe touch would be better, as many other said before).

Bought it on sale, it's totally worth the money for me. I do recommend it for small kids.

reviewText:
The game is probably one of the best tablet-to-steam ports I've played thus far (admittedly every other one I've ever played has been infuriatingly bad and/or broken, so the bar is incredibly low)
And no it's not a clean port - most of the hints are for a touch screen device and have not been edited out.
With a keyboard i was flying blind, but fortunately I had my trusty 360 controller plugged in and i was able to (hit everything until something worked) figure out the controls and I was seemingly able to perform every task necessary to completing levels.

At first I was really pleased. It started off very simple, and which made me think, wow
date: this would be a great game to keep kids busy on a low spec laptop or something."\n\nIt was cute
hoursPlayed:
and a decent way to waste time. Went to prepare a review for my YouTube channel to recommend this as a free to play game for folks with kids. That's when reality hit.

This wasn't a free game. THIS GAME IS 10 ♥♥♥♥ING DOLLARS. 10 ♥♥♥♥ING DOLLARS. one more time in case you missed something. This game cost 10 ♥♥♥♥ING DOLLARS. Are you serious?

I thought god this can't be right. There's no way it cost that much on ios. $1.99 ios.......really.....♥♥♥♥ing really? So no. no. Not for $9.99. never ever ever for that price. and honestly
